intro: Saintpaulia alba, commonly known as the white African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of about 10 to 20 centimeters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Saintpaulia alba is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
